definition: after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]

sentences.english: Life is like a red-hot iron, need dental laboratories to go.
sentences.chinese: 人生就像一块烧红的铁条，需要千锤百炼才能走好。

sentences.english: That good steel must be thoroughly tempered what strength can be more weather-beaten.
sentences.chinese: 千锤百炼才能够磨炼出好钢，饱经风霜才能更强。

sentences.english: I like the most is the life experience and thoroughly tempered.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的是生命有种种经验而千锤百炼。

sentences.english: Only by thoroughly tempered, can be a good steel.
sentences.chinese: 只有千锤百炼，才能成为好钢。

definition: to be tempered into a steel
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
lit. to get rid of the weeds and keep the flowers/to separate the wheat from the chaff (idiom)
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
to sculpt/to carve (jade)/ornate artwork/overly elaborate prose
variant of 洗練|洗练[xi3 lian4]
